padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2056344" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zawwarahmad"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1665098"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1665098.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zawwarahmad" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Arabian-Oud/Sultani-65420.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65420.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sultani"title="Sultani"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2056344ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2056344" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1665098">zawwarahmad</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-08">02/08/24 12:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>LVs attempt on delina?<br />
<br />
top notes: well-blended, fresh, sweet, green, fruity<br />
middle notes: fruity, sweet, warm, green<br />
base notes: linear from middle notes<br />
<br />
and better than delina.... performance is almost there. I wished it was stronger and lasted longer. <br />
overall very wearable, 8.75/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="2056344"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=2056344#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2055098" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2055098" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="karinavi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898071"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1898071.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="karinavi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2055098ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2055098" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898071">karinavi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-07">02/07/24 12:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>it's so bright and sweet initially, i honestly wish it stayed like that for the whole duration as it's really lovely. however, it develops a bit of earthiness as it wears (likely the patchouli) that i'm not a fan of. weirdly kinda smells like rice paper at a distance. too strong for me personally. a man with enough confidence could certainly pull this off, fragrance has no gender anyway.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="2055098"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=2055098#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2039803" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2039803" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vko"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1235554"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1235554.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="vko" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Dioriviera-81847.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81847.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dioriviera"title="Dioriviera"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2039803ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2039803" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1235554">vko</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-23">01/23/24 14:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Itâs a love for me. I agree with others, it does comes across generic at first but it has something special to it as it develops. The scent profile is similar to other perfumes that are out there and are more reasonably priced, but for me itâs worth the price as the cacao note really differentiate it from the rest and the patchouli makes it long lasting. I would recommend if you want to splurge. <br />
<br />
FWIW I do not like Coco Mademoiselle at all and I donât think the two compare (at least to my nose).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="2039803"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=2039803#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2038027" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2038027" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="handkmommy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1248294"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1248294.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="handkmommy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Phlur/Missing-Person-72665.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72665.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Missing Person"title="Missing Person"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2038027ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2038027" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1248294">handkmommy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-21">01/21/24 20:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Am I just crazy or do all  brands just recycling stuff and adding woody, peppery notes?<br />
This smells like a jolly rancher at the top. I love Jolly Ranchers, but really?<br />
Then it gives you pepper. Why? So you can say itâs more luxurious than  Jolly Rancher?<br />
<br />
Iâm not going to say I donât like it. I love the smell of Jolly Ranchers. I might wear this often, in fact. But, itâs definitely not worth the price at all. Maybe Iâll start to appreciate this more down the road, but for the moment this is what Iâm getting out of it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="2038027"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=2038027#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2022098" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; For some reason I can't detect the cacao. Just generic rose, peony and tart litchi. Strong projection and long lasting. <br />

I have a sample as part of the LV samples collection I got to try out before I get a full bottle. This one I'm not purchasing a full one for sure but it is an ok perfume so I will use the sample.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="2022098"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=2022098#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2012058" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2001136" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SnowIce"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1646922"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1646922.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SnowIce" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/L-Interdit-Eau-de-Toilette-2022-75822.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75822.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Interdit Eau de Toilette (2022)"title="L'Interdit Eau de Toilette (2022)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2001136ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2001136" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1646922">SnowIce</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-14">12/14/23 09:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Attrape-Reves is one of the most wonderful scents I have ever had the pleasure to smell. It's light and fresh; if you look at the Vuitton ads they describe the fragrance well. It's like a pale red sunbeam by the sea. A subtle and elegant hint of cocoa brings water to the tongue. A very artful and elegant fragrance, lasting and wonderfully seductive. Litchi is the absolute pinnacle of the fragrance, with its distinctive flavour on the palate. I don't usually like Rose notes, but together with Peony they create a freshness. A masterpiece! Infinitely girly!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="2001136"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=2001136#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1994088" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1980208" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Brookeapril23"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1433531"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Brookeapril23" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1980208ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1980208" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1433531">Brookeapril23</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-19">11/19/23 09:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Spot on for CK euphoria. Why spend 10x as much for the same smell?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1980208"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1980208#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1972266" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1418625">Elena_Dz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-09">11/09/23 01:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Agh... Reminds me of all the perfumes I didn't like (mostly Jimmy Choo). Too sweet, kind of sticky, I cannot determine any real note, to my nose this smells like mish-mash of everything. Cloying and just not my type od scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1972266"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1972266#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1942073" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1942073" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dsmercoco"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1090313"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1090313.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dsmercoco" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ormonde-Jayne/Champaca-4927.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4927.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Champaca"title="Champaca"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1942073ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1942073" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1090313">dsmercoco</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-01">10/01/23 18:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Gorgeous scent. It's much more than a fruity floral. The ginger in this really stand out on my skin and it's given loft from the litchi. In the mid things blend more but I get peek thrus of the cacao. It's addictive and an easy reach. I don't see how this could offend anyone. Office and close quarters friendly with good sillage and outstanding longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1942073"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1942073#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1938163" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Patchouli. This is longlasting, but Into The Night has better sillage. Not much else I can say that hasn't already been said. If you don't like Bath &amp; Body Works, YSL Mon Paris will get the job done without spending several hundred dollars.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1938163"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1938163#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1921681" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1921681" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jillvee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1750980"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1750980.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jillvee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Black-Vanilla-46662.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46662.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Vanilla"title="Black Vanilla"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1921681ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1921681" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1750980">jillvee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-06">09/06/23 22:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is really a beautiful scent. It has a surprisngly gorgeous, ripe fruity opening of lychee and really evolves, even lingering as a musky sweetness a few hours later. After initial drydown, on me, i get resemblences of Flowerbomb with the patchouli laced fruity-floral gourmand and towards the end reminds me of Angel Eau de Toilette Mugler from a few years back. I wish the surprising gorgeousness that this fragrance opens with lingered longer, which is the more unique aspect, with continued wear it became a bit more mundane and unrecognizable from it's former self. Still something I would occasionally wear for a special occasion, it does have good sillage for quite a while, but to me not worth the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1919617" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="elz2027"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757551"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1757551.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="elz2027" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-Eau-De-Parfum-71661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Rose Eau De Parfum"title="Eau Rose Eau De Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1919617ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1919617" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757551">elz2027</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-04">09/04/23 13:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I was checking perfumes from the store, I wasnât looking at this one. I didnât care about any of them and didnât know that this is actually hyped. But when the SA gave me a sample on paper, I fell inlove. Went to the store after some time to purchase something then I asked for a sample of this. I got two which Iâm happy about so I get to really test it. <br />
<br />
For a start, itâs the first time in a very long time that my husband complimented my perfume. Thatâs a HUGE plus to me because I always wanted him to like what Iâm wearing but his taste is different (heâs a citrus man, lol) and Iâm a fruity floral gourmand lover. So this hits the right spot. Itâs not thickly sweet but itâs there, itâs just right. So far, it survived the summer hear of Dubai without being cloying or headache inducing. I also got a compliment from an SA in Charlotte Tilbury store. Lol! So another hit points! So definitely projection is great! Tomorrow, Iâll get to wear in the office finally and then I can officially decide if Iâm gonna buy the full bottle. <br />
<br />
It smells feminine and a bit sweet without that overly mature vibes. I do get the BW Into the Night vibes in it (I just purchased that one to prove it!) but this one is sooo much more elevated and elegant. I feel put together and confident everytime I spray it on me. It lasts 6+hrs on me before I feel the need to respray but that okay for me. Whatâs not okay is that itâs already expensive then disappears within an hour like MFKâs GFG on me. For me, this one can be worn year-round, day or night. Itâs that versatile for me. Itâs bright but sexy at the same time. Itâs beautiful. <br />
<br />
Overall, Iâm inloooove with this perfume. I think I finally found my signature scent. Finally. :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1919617"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1919617#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1913831" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1433192">Trustmeimawriter</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-28">08/28/23 16:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is so beautifully blended and they somehow  figured out a way to make all the florals that are jam-packed in here not smell old lady or too green. And it's fresh without being classic laundry detergent freshie. <br />
<br />
The cost is absolutely crazy but if you go into a Louis Vuitton store get a sample and then go again and get another sample before you fully commit. I will say though when I wear this I get tons of compliments... once a check-in person at a restaurant follow me to my table to ask me what I was wearing and said everyone at the front desk kept talking about it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1913106" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Morealzz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396314"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Morealzz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1913106ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1913106" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396314">Morealzz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-27">08/27/23 20:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To my nose this smells like a fresher citrusy version of La Nuit TRESOR. They share the same litchi, the same rose but the patchouli in this is green and the patchouli in La Nuit is dirtier. This has an aquatic freshness to it and La Nuit is the sweeter syrupy version. Iâm surprised no one else thought this. Great fragrance but not monumental especially for the price tag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1913106"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1913106#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1908702" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1908702" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Strawberrykitty"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1669899"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1669899.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Strawberrykitty" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/I-Don-t-Need-A-Prince-By-My-Side-To-Be-A-Princess-50497.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50497.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="I Don't Need A Prince By My Side To Be A Princess"title="I Don't Need A Prince By My Side To Be A Princess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1908702ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1908702" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1669899">Strawberrykitty</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-22">08/22/23 10:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like Into the Night by Bath &amp; Body Works. Or rather, ITN smells like this since it was released after; that isnât a diss, I enjoy ITN a lot. This lasts for a short time with an intimate sillage, unlike ITN which is a powerhouse. I was shocked at the price tag. Get this if you have money to blow.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1908702"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1908702#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1906321" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It would not be worth it to me to get anything more than a sample of this but if you like Delina, Miss Dior etc pretty fresh feminine scents this would definitely be worth it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; It smells just beautiful and the dry down is beautiful as well. 8 hours of sleep woke up I could still smell it. It doesnât turn into a skin scent. Just beautiful fragrance and worth the money<br />

I walked in the gas station and I got stop wearing this. It does not remind me of Gucci Rush.  I don't think I need this one since I already have Mon Parfum..  It does smell good though..</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1852179"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1852179#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1850174" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; In most weather that is temperate or warm it is drier and the cacao makes it even feel dusty in the dry down. I think cold weather is best for it to shine and not get the dusty feel which is strange because itâs not a scent I gravitate toward in cooler weather being rather fruity and fresh. Because of its strange behavior it is a pass. Iâve worn this several times from a sample over the past 8 months or so.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1829570"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1829570#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1818394" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/59086">Vickalicious</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-26">04/26/23 16:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this! A fruity, rose patchouli (fruitchouli) that smells very mainstream and mass appealing, but I don't care, it works. It's similar to others on the market, but I like the fruitiness that this has, and how jammy the rose is; there is also a nice musk that comes out in the drydown. I feel like it's one of the better fruitchouli's out there. I was afraid this might be a little reminiscent of PdM Delina (a fragrance I don't like) based on some of the notes, but thankfully this doesn't remind me of Delina at all. Lastly, the performance on this is fantastic!! It lasts forever. I've added this to my "to buy" list!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1818394"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1818394#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1809845" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
I picture Attrape as the flirty outgoing sister and her smile is truly contagious, while as CÅur is the more serious one. She rarely joke around. If she do, itâs in the lines of something witty and charming. Some might even find her intimidating, because of her breathtakingly beauty.<br />
<br />
So you see, they look a like and obviously share the same dna.. but at the same time, they are very much different from one another. I truly appreciate them bothð¤</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1809845"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1809845#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1803578" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1803578" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nanaa_from_ghana"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509671"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nanaa_from_ghana" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1803578ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1803578" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509671">nanaa_from_ghana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-08">04/08/23 03:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one took me a few tries before I could fully appreciate it in all its beauty. Yes, I used to be a hater lol but now Iâm a believer! <br />
<br />
I donât have many fragrances with the combo of cacao, flowers, and patchouli. I absolutely love florals and patchouli, but cacao is a note that I struggle with from time to time. Itâs often added to many gourmand fragrances, so I was shocked to see it in the perfume pyramid here. In this fragrance, it adds a beautiful sweet depth that works really well. At first, I thought this smelled just like BBW Into The Night, which is why I was like âwell wtf is the point of this??? and for the price??? immediately noâ but I was quickly put into my place after the 2nd or 3rd wear of this. <br />
<br />
Attrape-RÃªves is a true fresh floral, heavy on the peony and rose, with a touch of aquatic litchi, and cacao and patchouli to make it unique and give it a sexy maturity. I donât get a lot of âspiceâ necessarily from this, but the ginger adds a nice sparkling effect. Based on the composition, this could be considered as a chypre but itâs done in such a fresh way. This is a compliment getter for sure and has good performance. If youâre not big on flowers and/or patchouli, skip this one. This is for the girlies that like sexy and grown-up florals with a twist. <br />
<br />
Itâs luxurious and Iâm so glad that I gave it another chance. I just bought a big bottle yesterday and Iâm very excited to have her for spring and summer. Although, this is one you can wear year-round. Very very very happy to be adding this beauty to my collection and I know sheâll be put to good use. I could totally see this being someone signature scent because itâs just so beautifully done and I couldnât see this offending anyone around you. <br />
<br />
This is my second LV fragrance! The other one I have is City of Stars â­ï¸, which I also love!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1803578"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1803578#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1803552" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19867">aqua76239</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-25">03/25/23 06:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I picked this one after smelling bunch of fragrances at LV store. I was surprised by the notes because I really don't smell ginger and bergamot. To my nose it was sweet floral oriental type of scent, and I think rose and cacao are very well blended. Patchouli is kind of faint here, and i only get a bit of it . Its does have a hint of fruit but its rather sophisticated and no one will think you are smelling like a fruit salad(Escada limited edition, cough cough).<br />
This smells expensive and grown up, career woman in her 30s, wearing designer outfit with high heels, going on a date kind of scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; I am selling my full bottle unopened with full LV boutique packaging for a discounted price. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1755967" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DariaFrancesca74"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1537588"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1537588.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DariaFrancesca74" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1755967ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1755967" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1537588">DariaFrancesca74</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-09">02/09/23 12:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Niche fragrance of Louis Vuitton's exclusive perfumery, created by Jacques Cavallier. Feminine fragrance that contains citrus opening notes of bergamot, the sour joy of lychee and the vivacity of ginger, widely perceptible notes. The olfactory evolution arrives in a bouquet of roses and peonies of rare beauty, immersed in an enveloping, unexpected, powdery, reassuring gourmand accord of cocoa that makes the blend absolutely unique. Fragrance with a sweet, gourmand Sillage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1755967"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1755967#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1736782" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; the cacao note is so sweet and creamy, and the patchouli compliments that sweetness so nicely, it's a very sexy combination. this works wonders during the summer (when I got the majority of the compliments), but because it's sweet it works during the colder weather just as fine. but I think this fragrance shines best during warmer weather! love it so freaking much, need to get a refill at LV soon. wouldn't say it's a safe blind buy though! go to the store and smell it first!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; When I wore it that night to work all I could smell for the first 4 hours was soft cocoa then around hour 5 patchouli came out of nowhere. Then my least favorite part was at the end of my shift it was pure cotton candy in the most natural form.. too much too sticky. At least by then it was a skin scent. I want the vanilla I got in the store. Maybe on my clothes or hair Ill get that:)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1669528"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1669528#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1668269" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1668269" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tonia1216"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/970083"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.970083.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tonia1216" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1668269ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1668269" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/970083">Tonia1216</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-17">10/17/22 17:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like it. I can see the comparison with Fenty but this is a little fresher and more floral. Fenty has a heavier berry note and is slightly sweeter. They both have a smooth creamy dry down though. I think this is suitable all year round. And random question, but does anyone else get a slight Barbie Doll hair smell in the opening note? No? I guess itâs just me then lol</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1668269"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1668269#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1620802" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1620802" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Profumo_Furiosa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1550040"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1550040.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Profumo_Furiosa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Franck-Boclet/Cafe-55432.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55432.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cafe"title="Cafe"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1620802ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1620802" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1550040">Profumo_Furiosa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-10">08/10/22 08:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a fragrance has definitely let me you floating in a field of wildflowers on a summer's day. A fragrance that embraces the best parts of being alive IMO. A poetic dream, created with the finest natural ingredients as far as my nose could detect. I like wearing this not just because it smells nice, but because it reminds me of a time before I knew the world was cruel. That time when I was happy and naive, and everything smelled of blueberry muffins and vanilla, its heart notes feature the sweet, woody scent of milky santal and wild atlas cedar. It has a delicate, fruity floral heart with notes framed by lavender, white gardenia and oakmoss. This poetic fragrance combines a rich and delectable vanilla note with a sophisticated, tangy blueberry. This scent is perfect for any occasion; it's sophisticated, yet light. When you wear it, you'll smell woodsy at first, but when it settles on your skin the sweet blueberries come out.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1620802"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1620802#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1615545" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1609636"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1609636#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1598738" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1598738" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dommymichelle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1359486"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1359486.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dommymichelle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fragrance-Du-Bois/Sirene-91166.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91166.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="SirÃ¨ne"title="SirÃ¨ne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1598738ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1598738" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1359486">dommymichelle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-07">07/07/22 19:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My first splurge fragrance purchase, and entirely on a whim. I received a sample at the flagship Paris store (how bougie!) after making my very first LV purchase several years ago. I took the sample with me to a wedding in Italy (late spring on the Amalfi coast!), and almost every man I came in contact with said "OMG you smell SO GOOD." Like some weird catnip for straight boys, idk. Based on the rave reviews from the opposite sex, I grabbed a bottle before returning home to the US. <br />
<br />
I personally thought it was dreamy and really unique... I haven't smelled anything quite like it (the cocoa-litchi-rose combo is really special!). TBH I'm surprised at the reviews saying this is generic. I digress. For a fragrance with patchouli and cocoa, this is surprisingly fresh. It's VERY powerful, SERIOUS projection â spray too much and you'll get a migraine (I made this mistake, lol). And it really does last. <br />
<br />
I was immediately enamored with this pretty pink potion, and obviously am a sucker for the compliments. If it works with your skin chemistry, and it's your style, it's a beautiful formulation that'll last you a long time and draw some attention. It's seasonless, great for day or night, really elegant and feminine, and youthful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1598738"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1598738#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1591673" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1591673" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LoveBaseNotes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1456607"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1456607.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LoveBaseNotes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1591673ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1591673" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1456607">LoveBaseNotes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-26">06/26/22 07:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I want to love this so badly. Iâm a huge LV lover and really wanted to add a fragrance to my collection. I received many samples with my bag purchases over the years, but none really stood out (or even came close to be a âlikeâ let alone a love). I guess I somehow convinced myself Attrape Reves was full bottle worthy. But every time I try to wear it, I canât stand it and end up with a headache. I can see how people would love this. It just doesnât work for me. Iâm hoping that will change one day (maybe Iâll fall in love with it at some point). For now, Iâve come to terms with this just being a nod to the house in my perfume collection. I will say that it has incredible longevity and projection!  A plus for those who like the fragrance!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1591673"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1591673#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1576682" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1576682" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="helenearne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1458178"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1458178.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="helenearne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lys 41"title="Lys 41"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1576682ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1576682" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1458178">helenearne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-02">06/02/22 23:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Veey pretty, feminine floral fragrance! It opens very rose forward, which unfortunately is not really my thing, but after half an hour it settles into something more subtle. Its still roseforward, but the lychee gives it more sweetness and the pachouli grounds it nicely! Very feminine and pretty.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1576682"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1576682#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1576048" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1576048" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="apentias"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1161704"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1161704.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="apentias" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Coeur-Battant-57129.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57129.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="CÅur Battant"title="CÅur Battant"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1576048ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1576048" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1161704">apentias</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-02">06/02/22 02:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was given a sample of this with an LV purchase on a trip, along with Coeur Battant. These two are very similar and, as a niche fraghead, I rejected both at first try as 'too ordinary'. How utterly stupid of me. I get trapped into the 'concept' aspect of a fragrance and often forget what I actually smell like in them. So, on that trip, I decided to wear them just for kicks and both were *magnificent*, but AR is my favourite between the two. It's addictive. First of all, the patchouli, of which I am not a fan, is sublimely blended here- as a grounding vehicle and nothing more. On me, this scent smells like a radiant, blooming, fuschia flower in a tropical climate. It's not a 'lots-of-money' smelling fragrance like Kurkdjian creations, it's feminine/big/sexy/refined. It's designed to appeal to many but, for me, it stills falls within niche territory because the fruit and patchouli take the florals into that gauche side-street. Can't detect the cocoa on me to be honest. Along with MFK's Feminin Pluriel, it is my top floral fragrance. After months of deliberation, I just ordered a full bottle. It's too good to not have in my collection and has already gone up in price, considerably. The only reason I did not order it straight away is that it doesn't last long enough to satisfy its steep price tag. But, I adore it so much, I'll overlook that. To me, it leans feminine but I'll definitely test it on my husband as well. I find most modern fragrances to be absolutely unisex in practice- they smell differently and somehow work very well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1576048"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1576048#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1573972" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; In the LV store I sprayed this and Rose De Vents and decided upon Attrapes-Reves. Within 3-4 hours the dry down turns completely to patchouli and nothing else remains detectable. padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1446728">marianna.0205</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-20">03/20/22 16:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a full bottle of woman in gold by kilian that I would trade for this. Im based in europe. :) text me if youâre interested</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1527191"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1527191#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1525886" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1525886" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Wednesdaychild41"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191239"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1191239.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Wednesdaychild41" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Papillon-Artisan-Perfumes/Epona-95954.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95954.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Epona"title="Epona"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1525886ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1525886" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191239">Wednesdaychild41</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-18">03/18/22 14:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm so confused about how i feel about this one. On first sniff it's genuinely a typical young soft fruity floral with that thick fluffy style musk (tip toeing in to Cashmeran territory which i hate). .it suffocates all the lovely sweet floral and fruits, creating an almost plasticy edge. <br />
<br />
One thing i do notice, and which is the reason i keep coming back for more. . Is the cocoa note. It does notice on me, and it glides over the fragrance like a thin layer of milk chocolate. Subtle but there. The chocolate reminds me of the chocolate in Boss The Scent Private Accord for her. The plasticy aspect reminds me of My Burberry edt, and watery/ aquatic aspects reminds me of Delina La Rosee. Also the fluffy character reminds me of Angel edt.<br />
Lots of different ways to see this scent, but overall it's very mass appealing, but not luxurious or sophisticated in the slightest. <br />
<br />
There's elements of it i do enjoy, and want to keep seeking out.  But that price tag. . . Just no.<br />
<br />
*Update*<br />
I totally bought it. Well, in the end i just enjoyed it so much. No regrets, it makes me happy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1525886"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1525886#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1524776" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Its super syrupy sweet - if you're into that, you'll like Attrape-Reves.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="51016"comment_id="1524776"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Attrape-Reves-51016.html?ccid=1524776#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1428862" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
